title: Essay on Shiny Live
text:
Shinylive is a new serverless framework that allows you to run Shiny apps entirely in the browser—no R server required.






Shiny (Traditional)
Shinylive




Requires R server
Runs in browser


More powerful
Lightweight


Server cost
Free to host on static sites






Pros: - No backend required - Runs on GitHub Pages - Fast to deploy
Cons: - Limited interactivity (no file uploads, persistent memory) - Only for small/medium apps

title: Home
text:
Adib Mazloom




I aspire to apply data science in solving real-world problems through interactive analytics and R programming.




R Programming
Data Visualization (ggplot2, Quarto)
Shiny Apps & Shinylive
Statistical Analysis




Bachelor’s Degree in Aerospace Engineer
University of California, San Diego

title: Dashboard
text:
1 Dashboard
This page contains my Quarto dashboard using a dataset of my choice.


Code
# Sample summary plot using built-in data
library(ggplot2)
ggplot(mpg, aes(class)) +
  geom_bar(fill = "steelblue") +
  theme_minimal()

title: Essay on Shiny Apps
text:
Shiny is an R package that allows you to build interactive web applications directly from R.


Shiny lets you wrap R code with a user interface so users can interact with data and visualizations in real-time.




Interactive dashboards
Real-time data analysis
Educational tools




To teach Shiny, I’d cover: - The ui and server structure - Reactive expressions - shinyApp(ui, server) framework
